overview: My research focus is on improving the surgical and radiosurgical treatment of primary and metastatic brain and spine tumors. My research includes understanding the molecular mechanisms that drive the formation of primary and metastatic brain tumors, including cancer stem cells. I am also interested in developing and trialing targeted therapies that improve the medical control of brain tumors. I am also interested in advancing surgical technologies that will improve outcomes for primary and metastatic spine tumors. These in include minimally invasive techniques that allow for maximal survival benefit and pain relief with minimal morbidity.
research_interests:
Targeting of glioblastoma stem cells using phage display, developing targeted therapeutics for primary and metastatic brain tumor. Use of immune therapy to target primary brain tumors, including gamma delta T cells for targeting glioblastoma. Optimizing treatment for spinal tumors, including metastatic spine disease. Use of targeted therapies for the treatment of metastatic spine disease. Comparison of open and percutaneous techniques for treatment of spinal tumors.
